description:
Sorry, pictures are half eaten haha! 

We got the veggie and pepperoni. 
I think the asparagus should've been cooked prior to being put in the oven, it made the pizza have a bitter taste to the pizza which was a shame because the crust was wonderful. It also might be delicious with pesto instead of marinara. Overall it was good but not great. 

The pepperoni was delicious, however. 

The service was quick and they were fine with customizations. They give you a red pepper flake and parmesan cheese packet for each pizza.
author: Alissa C.

description:
Soggy wet pizza that you had to bite hard into for the crust to tear off.

Didn't even feel like eating the whole thing and threw it away.
author: Sukh S.

description:
If you like corporate pizza, this is your place.

1st:
Their main problem was the clunky web based system DELAYED the order. This is documented. And they ultimately admitted they shorted a simple three item order without explanation. 

PIZZA, COLA AND ICE CREAM - THAT WAS THE WHOLE ORDER - AND THEY FORGOT THE ICE CREAM.

2nd: The driver got to the delivery location but "did not know where the front door was." 

I told him OF COURSE there is a front door. He said he would look again.  He did not care and did not look for the front door.

At the delivery location, the driver sat in the road double parked, doing nothing, until someone came to his window saying he was looking for a delivery. Driver never had to get out of his vehicle. 

But the order was missing one item: The famous Mitchell's Chocolate Ice Cream. So wonderful, but now it is missing. Where is the bleeping ice cream??

3rd: I called the restaurant to figure out what happened to the ice cream in the order. First call connected before closing time but it was promptly disconnected. The second call rolled over to VM. Gee do you wonder why I am frustrated?  So i read them the riot act via VM and moved on.

You spend the money to do something nice for your SO on his birthday and what do you get -- a small disaster that no one really wants to talk about.  Where is the ice cream?? Crappy CS.

4th: The "Founder" wrote me an email saying he knows this must have been frustrating and he will refund the order. Yeah, imagine your frustration when you call the pizza place to talk about the order and they hang up on you because it's almost closing time. Now that's FRUSTRATING! Then you receive an contemptible email from someone posing as someone who cares (aka Founder), after 11:30 PM. WTF?

The "Founder" of company was deeply offended when I called Firepie staff idiots, via VM, but he did not care to hear any details of the poor service. (What happened to the ice cream?) He then proceeded to talk about the "bright people" in this org. How nice for you - more corporate pablum. 

And then, like a Commandment from God, the "Founder" FIRED ME AS A CUSTOMER. ROTFL. Only an idiot would say no to repeat business. Duh.

And I won't go into the CS line I called, which was answered by some guy in the PHILIPPINES. (How on Earth is a guy in the Philippines going to help me resolve my issue? He didn't.)

Beware Firepie - one of the first NO HUMAN CONTACT, corporatized pizza chain, with the first CS line to support your order - in the PHILIPPINES. And never order late in the evening because no one will care.

Incompetence reared its ugly head at every turn.  

If you like talking to the people who care about your food and you, avoid this place.
author: Liz B.

description:
The main benefit of this place for us was its proximity to St. Luke's hospital when we needed a quick dinner. 

We tried all three pizzas, and they were fine, nothing super memorable. Their crusts were a little hard, though about 20 minutes had passed before we ate the pizzas.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Was really just OK. I was a little disappointed to spend $25 for 2 10" pies (cheese and salame) that tasted mediocre. If anything, the salame one is the only worth going back for. 

The coolest part about this experience is that yes, you really do get your pizza in 90 seconds! It was hot and fresh. The server at the front counter was very friendly. 

I do feel it's a bit hyped up though, because there just wasn't enough substance to qualify the prices and the cheese wasn't as savory as I had hoped it to be!
author: Jazzica D.

description:
Walk your pizza loving butt to this truck on Cesar Chavez and delight your senses! 
A+, 5-stars. Delicious, crispy crust pizza, in 90 seconds. We live nearby to the truck so we always eat the pizza hot and quickly after cooking, the only way! Also, we always order the cheese and the veggie. This pizza is, taste-wise, some of my favorite in the city and wait-wise, the clear champion. I love Firepie pizza for its taste, crust, friendly service, and, yes, the non-existent wait time.
author: Dana H.

description:
The owner has reached out about this and offered to comp my next meal. I'll update after that experience. 

Pizza was great. Very minor charring and extremely tasty.
author: Sean Y.

description:
This pizza could not have arrived faster. Blown away at the delivery speed. 

My expectations were low, because how good could a pizza that fast be? But they were actually pretty damn good. Delfina is my pizza quality baseline, so I have a pretty high bar. 

Pepperoni was the better of the two, mainly because of the arugula.

A good test is pizza leftovers. Held up pretty good.

4 stars for combination for decent quality and ridiculous speed.
author: Simon S.

description:
We ordered delivery from here while in town and the pizzas were delicious. 

Thin crusts from a pizza oven. Great char. Good sauce. Loved the toppings. 

We tried the three cheese, vegetarian and pepperoni...all were very tasty! I liked the pepperoni the best. The pizzas are small size. We had three and a small side salad with arugula for five girls sharing and there were pieces left over. 

Deliver was fast and the food travelled well.
author: Lianne S.

description: Again I am blown away by the quality and consistency of Fire Pie.  I always get exactly what I order and it never upsets my stomach like most pizza places.  So far Fire Pie is still the best Pizza in San Francisco.  Thanks Fire Pie for never disappointing.
author: Michael M.

description:
Located on a corner lot on Cesar Chavez & Valencia, it's a trailer that makes pizzas pretty quickly. The menu is super simple, there's only 3 pizzas on the menu, but I suppose you can subtract an ingredient if you want. The only thing was it does state there is a 90 second cook time, but your entire wait will be more than that. 

I ordered the pepperoni pizza. The price is maybe a dollar or two higher than I would like, but I will say the quality is very good and it did taste fine.  The crust can at points be slightly burnt, bu since it's cooked at such a high temp that is expected..and it wasn't a big deal.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Firepie is most certainly fire pie. This is some tasty pizza. 

Quick, clean, delivery friendly, and relatively affordable I was pretty impressed with my experience at Firepie. The crust has a nice char on the outside but was soft and doughy on the inside. The best bites were towards the crust where the dough was slightly thinner and a touch darker creating a lovely slightly caramelized crunch. 

The pepperoni had a perfectly distributed amount of meat without being overly salty or greasy. I've never had a pepp pizza topped with arugula, and while it didn't add a ton of flavor it brought a nice fresh complement to the usually heavier pepperoni. 

The veggie pizza had a real nice amount of veggies on it and it's the first time I've had asparagus on a pizza, which was great. They substituted basil instead of arugula for me no problem and everything was fresh and crisp. 

Both pizzas had a nice sharp garlic punch mixed in with the cheese and robust sauce that really brought the whole experience home. If you're in the area or feelin lazy from home, this is a great not too heavy not too pricey option for your pizza fix.
author: Sean S.

description:
90 second 'za and there are 2 veggie options, what's not to love? 

The cheese/sauce to dough ratio is solid, none of that all dough no good stuff at this place. 

How do they do it? They have a 900 degree wood fire oven 

THIS PLACE IS ON FIRE! Love it, have already been back several times for more pies
author: Lucy W.

description:
Ordered delivery using Eat24. I live quite near them, and had been meaning to try them for a while, but this was my first time. 

Was told that they would require extra time due to heavy business on a Saturday night BUT in fact my order arrived about ten minutes after I placed it, so well within the twenty minutes that's part of their shtick. I was quite surprised to hear the doorbell ring 30 minutes ahead of what I was expecting based on Eat24. 

For what you get the price is fair. I ordered the pepperoni pizza (though I was tempted by the cheese) as well as the arugula salad. The salad was squeezed in a small plastic container. But there was enough salad for two people. It was really fresh and tasty. 

The pizza was miraculously hot and fresh. Plenty of cheese, a tasty, seemingly homemade chunky sauce and generous sausage. 

I was thoroughly satisfied and will order again.
author: Tim P.

description: Firepie is almost too good to be true. First of all, it's ridiculously fast. This pizza traveled from the mission to NOPA in 11 minutes. Forget Jimmy Johns... Firepie is so fast you'll freak. Plus, it's pretty darn high quality pizza considering it was literally out for delivery maybe 5 minutes after I ordered it. As some people pointed out, the crust is charred on some points, but I think it gives the crust a delicious taste, and it is never charred to the point where it overrules the taste of the crust. I'm honestly impressed with Firepie, and I will continue to be their customer.
author: Kerry K.

description:
I hate that I loved this pizza so much because TBH I can't comprehend gourmet delivery personal-size pizza. Each pizza is about $13 which I find a bit expensive for a small 10'' pizza. But, the flavor was fantastic. 

The marinara tomato sauce was on point and the char on the pizza crust was great. The pictures in UberEats app though did make it seem like more arugula would be on top of the pepperoni pizza, so I was a bit disappointed when we only got 5 pieces of arugula. The three cheese pizza was also fantastic...and really can't be described as plain. Has a nice balance of flavor with the basil.
author: Jess Y.

description:
Really love the pizza. For the price you definitely can't do better in SF.

But a couple things knock it down a peg:

1) Yes, perhaps they do only cook the pizzas for 90 seconds -- but since they're so popular, at dinner it often takes nearly half an hour to get a pizza. And the Eat24 estimates are consistently wrong... I've shown up 3 times at exactly the estimated time, and each time I've had to wait 10 minutes more.

2) It would be nice to have more salad options. E.g. a Caesar salad. Or maybe a green goddess. Or something creative.
author: Jon E.

description:
Ordered Firepies for my sons birthday at Dolores Park. I have never seen pizza go so fast in my LIFE!! Kids, adults, everyone was raving. There's somethin about these pizzas I'm tellin you! The service and delivery was on point too. We LOVE FIRE PIE! 

Can you please expand to Oakland ?
author: Blaire J.

description:
We ordered pizza from here once from Bare bottle brewery. The delivery was very swift but they switched up our order with someone else's delivery, so it took 10 minutes longer (only 10 minutes!). 

They even threw in ice cream to make up for it!

We got the vegetarian pizza which was awesome - perfect crust and sauce and taste! Love the simple menu and speedy delivery.
author: Namrata J.

description:
Pier 39 of pizza. Huge disappointment. 

I have never felt so ripped off. There are certain promises from Firepie: 1) 90-second delicious wood-fired artisan pizza and 2) 15 minute delivery (Average delivery times 12-21 minutes depending on address). All of this verbiage comes on a postcard that comes with the delivery.

First of all, I paid $38 for two 10-Inch pizzas, willing to pay for both convenience and quality. I placed the order at 10:35pm and received an email saying my delivery was to arrive at 11:05pm. No biggie--30 minutes is still great considering how long it takes for other pizza places to deliver. Pizza didn't arrive until 11:20pm. I was willing to excuse all of this if the pizza was worth it.

Not even close. The pizzas were undercooked. And not even to a point of preference. The dough just wasn't cooked through (despite being so thin!). The bottom of the pizzas were pale white because it didn't cook long enough. After taking a bite, the pizza was chewy and the cheese was barely melted, making the texture very unsettling. If you take a look at my pictures, you can't even tell the difference between the cheese and the dough. It was that bad. I scraped the cheese off the tip of one slice and the dough was almost translucent because it was so undercooked. It was worse than frozen pizza, same level as gas station pizza. I wish I was exaggerating. 

Look, if I paid 5 dollars for each of these pizzas at a 7/11 or something, I wouldn't complain, but damn near $40 for this and I just get upset. I find myself getting upset. I was played for a fool. 

Firepie offered me a discount code to get 10 percent off my next order. Really? 

I really wanted to like this place. I wanted to love it. Neighborhood joint, fast delivery, but it just didn't happen. Fell short on every promise.
author: Anthony G.

description:
Is it a good value in terms of size? No. For about 20 bucks you get a small pizza that is expertly done... but small. On the other hand, where can you call at 10pm and have a pizza show up at your door 10 min later? I'm a fan.

If the pie was a little bigger, this would be 5 stars no question.
author: Alice W.

description: Great pizza. I'm not a crust person but the thin crust is very tasty. Firepie is fairly priced, and has fresh ingredients with great service.
author: Stevonne R.

description: My pizza was delivered burnt. This really shows the integrity of this place. Even when they knew the pizza was burnt black they still gave it away in hopes that the customer won't notice they're eating a burnt pizza. Will not return.
author: Angela T.

description: The pizza was $20 for a small little pie that was not advertised as a personal pizza. Everything tasted OK but wasn't worth the price. It was burnt and I would rather have spent my money buying a pizza from the pizza isle at the super market. (Cheaper and tastes better) We had this delivered to us via Uber eats and no where did it say it was 10" or a personal pizza. I also ordered ice cream which I received with freezer burn and not even full.($7) this place could have been great but I am still hungry and left with a huge disappointment. I wish I could get my $30 back and I will make sure that I tell people not to eat their burnt over priced pie that took over 40 minutes to get 5 min away.
author: Melissa G.

description: Pizza is delicious, but sometimes they do burn it a little too much. I get their pizza at least once a week and their veggies always taste fresh.
author: Ben C.

description:
I'm a regular at Firepie.  I like it, but don't love it, as in "die for pizza".  I think it makes more sense price wise when I get the 2 dollar off coupon.  At 16 bucks (or so) at regular price, I'm probably better off going to the pizza hacker on upper Valencia (if I have the time).

But where these guys really shine, is that they really do make it in like 90 seconds.  There have been times when the pizza was done by the time I was finished paying.  So, when I'm at that place where its late, I don't have food in the fridge, don't feel like cooking and I want something like NOW..these guys come to the front of the list.

I think there sauce is quite good, for me I wish the crust was a tad crisper.  Even when they char it a bit too much it still has a bit of chewy feel, and I'm NY crust kind of guy all the way.

I've only had the pepperoni, I always get it with the Arugula, so can't comment on their other choices.  It's on the smaller side, but even when hungry, it feeds one person to satisfaction.  Even have to think twice about that last slice, but we know how that is going to end.

Finally, a call out to their great crew.  They have always been friendly, helpful and generally have good vibes, and that should count for something.
author: Art B.

description: I felt like I was in the Midwest, drove off the interstate and hit up a tollway oasis for a bite and was then on my way.  Quick pick up and unlike a tollway oasis, Firepie was delish!
author: Rafael R.

description: Hungry one night I ordered delivery from Firepie. Kinda dig their thing online.  Pizza showed up, not too pricey, quite fast. Good. Pizza itself...just a-ok, no more. I kinda had everything right (kinda burnt crust, kinda fresh toppings) but something was just not quite there (wasn't really crispy on the ends and was kinda soggy in the middle).  I'm not sure if this is what they are going for or if I just had a bad day. I'll try again for sure, but here's to holding my breath.
author: David S.

description:
The best part of the pizza is definitely the crust - its got a great smokey flavor that reminds me is a New York style pie like Grimaldi's. I got the Salame Piccante and definetly enjoyed it. My significant other got La Verduna, I probably would have enjoyed it more if they hadn't burnt the crust and then proceeded to scrape off the inedible parts. I didn't think anything of it when I saw them do it, but it really killed the flavor and make it hard to compare to my unburned pizza.

There aren't a lot of options so if you're looking for a lot of variety, go elsewhere. I probably wouldn't go out of my way for this place but it's on the way back home so why the heck not.
author: Travis V.

description:
I love pizza. Esp pizza that is ready in 90 sec..


But Id rather have pizza that is ready in 20 min as long as its not burnt. I ordered 2 pepperoni pizzas from this place and was planning on sharing it between my wife, myself, and my DAUGHTER. The top of my pizza looked great. But the flip side was Black. No way can I feed her that. Disappointed for the price I paid for these small burnt pizzas.
author: Chris B.

description: Had to update my review after 2 years + going here.  The pizza is alright but expensive for the amount you get.  My main issue is with their customer loyalty program, originally is was after 10 you get one free, then that changed to $10 off after you buy 10.  BEWARE they lost all my customer information and I had a $10 off due.  They wanted me to give them all my info AGAIN and would give me a few credits...meaning I lost the previous 10+ credits I should have had.  Sorry, not worth the hassle and the "managers" input was not helpful.   This is a food truck, not a fancy restaurant with high overhead.  $12 for a tiny plain pizza? I will not be back, there are far too many other places with better prices as well.
author: John C.

description:
I'm a fan of Firepie! What stands out for me is the excellent customer service I've experienced on each visit. The staff are always friendly and helpful. Once, I ordered a pie for pickup and took a long time to pick it up, and someone from Firepie called to check in, remind me about the order, and make sure that the pizza would be warm when I came to get it! I really appreciate how they go above and beyond in ways like this to give customers a great experience.

The pizza is pretty good, and is always ready fast and reasonably priced. Ordering through their app is a breeze, too. I'm so glad we have a place like this in the neighborhood for convenient takeout!
author: Christine G.

description: Really good, fresh ingredient pizza. I frequently order Firepie via Uber Eats, and haven't had any bad experiences that were within Firepie's control (cold pizza, long delivery times quite often). I wish they offered chicken instead of pepperoni but their cheese pizza is fantastic. This is the best small/semi-affordable delivery pizza in SF that i've had.
author: Brett H.

description:
Found this place while looking for a parking spot near El Rio. The 90sec walk up sounded enticing, I could tell I'd be hangry if I continued the party without food.

The employees were pleasant and my pizza was done in 90seconds! I also received a Thank You letter because I was a first time customer. 

Personable experience I didn't expect!
author: Jamie T.

description:
Super thin crust is nice, otherwise it's overpriced and a normal slice of good and a tad boring. 

Personal pizzas only, $13 for four small skinny slices. We bought two + tax and tip = $32+ way too much for what it is.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: No frills food truck that serves a pretty good piping hot pie. We were surprised on how good the crust was. A solid choice for picking up some good pizza.
author: A B.

description:
Best I've had in the Bay! 

Great quality. Great service. Real deal, crispy thin crust. And CRAZY FAST.

If you're afraid of a good charred crust, just order Pizza Hut. ;)
author: Kim B.

description: Pizza is legit good and always super hot thanks to the insanely fast delivery. Really love them for figuring out a way to make ordering pizza so fast and easy. Customer service is solid too.
author: G. B.

description:
Their pizzas are my forever fave. It's extremely yummy! I always wonder: why does it taste so good? 

The delivery is very swift, so you could enjoy your pizzas immediately. The delivery man always smiles that's why there's always a good vibe in the air before eating my pizzas :)
author: Althea C.

description: i enjoyed the vegetarian pizza.  Like the shaved red onions and asparagus, the arugula, and the garlicky tomato sauce.  I only wish they would add a generous drizzle of good olive oil before boxing it up!
author: H S.

description:
Last Sunday I came back to FirePie's pizza trailer for a redo of my previous pizza order. Because the owner Rick R. had contacted me to apologize for the overcooked tough pizzas. I was impressed, Rick is an awesome owner who cares deeply about both operating a good business and addressing customer concerns.

He personally cooked my 3 pizzas to make sure nothing went wrong this time.

It was a huge improvement. The pizza crust was light yet still crisp. No tough crust this time, and plenty of cheese too. Both the 3 Cheese ($10) and Pepperoni ($12) were our favorite pizzas of the trio. I was happy with the amount of toppings on all 3 pizzas.

Note that I drove there to pick up the pizzas (very limited street parking at night), so we got to eat the pizzas while still hot (minutes after coming off the oven). I haven't tried their delivery service (I live too far away from current delivery zone).

Service is super friendly, much nicer than the typical grouchy service at local late night pizzerias.

It was raining on that Sunday night. But don't worry if u forgot to bring an umbrella, they have pink umbrella loaners to use while waiting for your food order.

Note: Get a FREE Three Twins ice cream minicup (chocolate or vanilla) with Yelp check-in. Just show offer on your smartphone to cashier.

Definitely worth trying out if craving for some good pizza and/or Three Twins ice cream cups at night.
author: Luis C.

description: Been coming to this place for years. This is always my go to spot whenever I want a quick bite. Speedy service!
author: Greg S.

description:
When I realized this is a food truck, my excitement to try the pizza increased exponentially. How cool! They haven't been around too long, but they really got the pizza business down. Prices are really good for our market, especially given the taste. Great crust, awesome sauce (ha!), and less oily than many pizzas I've had. 

Good job, guys. I'll be back soon.
author: Paulina F.

description:
Perfect char on this Firepie crust!
Love the Vegetarian pie with arugula.
author: Geri S.

description: FirePie. Well obviously, as the name states it is fire. This pizza is literally so incredible. I chose the veggie one and all of the veggies were super fresh, the pizza was piping hot and they made it in no joke what felt like five minutes. I ate the entire thing. Great service, speedy pizza and most importantly TASTED AMAZING. Plus they have an app!!! This pizza is what the pizza market needs. I wish the truck was parked outside my house.
author: Taylor B.

description: Following up on my first review...the owner of Firepie gave me a credit for my last order. I appreciate the follow up!
author: David W.

description:
10 inches of goodness.

Does SF really need more artisan pizza?

As long as it's good pizza, then keep it coming.

Quality over quantity.

Enter Firepie.

Fire is in reference to the quick fire cooking.  Once your order is in, you're only 90 seconds away from your finished pie.

Unless you're getting delivery.  In which case, you'll be 90 seconds plus 15 minutes away from your finished pie.

Apparently they guarantee the 15 minute delivery.

Music to your ears, right?

Delivery is limited to only the immediate mission area; which explains how they can guarantee the swift delivery time.  Even so, it's impressive.

Perhaps the biggest eyebrow raiser here is their app.  

Can you imagine if Pizzeria Delfina or Tony's had an app?

I know.  We can dream.

The crust was solid but not overdone or tough.  I've read reviews that say the contrary, & all I can surmise is that there are good days & off days like w everything else.

The 3 cheese was uber flavorful, as simple as it is.  But the pie that topped the trio was the veggie.  Red onion, mushrooms, asparagus, mozzarella & arugula.  A great combination.  The kicker was the asparagus.  It's cut crosswise into very thin coins.  So the flavor accentuates rather than dominates.  It was different & delicious.

This is good pizza.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: WTF, 4.5 stars for this food , the only good thing about this food is quick nothing more and nothings less. I have just ordered Vegetarian pizza 10" , it cost me almost $15. The pizza was really shitty , thin burned pizza. I can say one star for the food , 5 stars for the time but I care about the quality more than time , I would prefer spend my money in Pizza Hut rather spending it here!
author: Mo'ad A.

description:
Really satisfying pizza! I tried the Salame Piccante topped with fresh arugula. Delicious!!! The crust is perfect.
Luckily I live nearby!
author: Mimo H.

description:
Firepie is my new favorite thin crust pizza in SF. I ordered three times (one cheese pizza and one pepperoni pizza each time) before reviewing to make sure the experience was consistent, and it was. Thin crust with slightly burnt spots and tender inside, as a wood fired pizza should be. Excellent distribution of cheese, sauce, and garlic. And the pepperoni is high quality. Perfection!

Plus, delivery on the Mission was super fast and the delivery guys were nice and friendly every time.

Thanks for existing, Firepie! I can't wait to put you in my tummy again!
author: Angela G.

description:
Artisanal crust, fresh a** toppings, arrived within 30 minutes, watched a basketball game as I chowed down, so yummy. 

Tummy satisfied.

Will mama do it again?

Hell yaaaaaaa!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
I order from here frequently now.  The delivery is faster than anyone else, reliably within ~20 minutes.  Unlike some of the other reviewers I've had no soggy crusts - it is in fact the crust that makes this pizza shine.  It's perfectly crispy on the bottom, without devolving to into crackerdome.  The toppings are great as well.

The only downside is that they charge for delivery, on top of an already pricey personal portion.  I can't really complain though - if I didn't want to pay I could just get off my butt and go get it myself.
author: Thomas R.

description: Decent pizza and very quick!  SF isnt known for its pizza but Firepie is good and the ingredients are fresh. We got one of each pizza-- the pepperoni was tastiest followed by the veggie.  It wasn't as great as some of the others I like (ex. Escape from NY) but decent especially given the speedy delivery time.
author: Maryanna Q.

description:
Review update. Owner messaged me apologizing for the poor quality and refunded me. Great costumer service.

Old review:
Yes the food came really fast, but it didn't override the quality for the price. I ordered the regular and pepperoni. The sauce wasn't very good, and the crusts of both were extremely burnt. I took one bite of the pepperoni and something was so off tasting that I threw out the pie. The price for the size and quality is a little ridiculous even for San Francisco. I was very disappointed.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I'm pretty confused - there are tons of good reviews for their pizza, but my three-cheese pizza arrived extremely burnt on the bottom and edges of the crust. Some slices were downright inedible. I think the flavor's pretty solid underneath all that bitter char? But it's honestly hard to tell. 

It's also quite a light pizza, much lighter than other 10" personal pizzas I've gotten elsewhere - you'll definitely need a salad or something with this to not still be hungry afterwards. 

I also can't shake the strong frozen pizza vibe I get from the presentation and the crust, which is rather unfortunate.

It also turns out that I didn't get any dressing with my arugula salad. :/
author: M. Q.

description: Awesome, mind blowing pizza! Reinvented right here in San Francisco after thousands of years of other mediocre countries trying to perfect it!
author: H K.

description: Excellent pizza and quick delivery.   Firepie is my new go to pizza delivery service!
author: Chris B.

description:
Probably all I need to say is when I visit SF from NYC, I stop at Firepie. 

Pie so perfectly cooked and season. Roadside oak fired pizza with pure and simply delicious ingredients and no wait. The one thing about thin crust wood fired pizza is there is no margin for error. If the crust ain't crackin' the pie is lackin' - soggy bottoms happen too frequently especially with a veggie pizza. So far that has never happened at Firepie and I doubt it ever will. They have the VERY high heat, crust thickness, and sauce ratio totally MASTERED.
author: I. V.

description: Ordering and picking up dinner at Firepie could not be any easier.  The employees are beyond friendly and move quickly to get your order to you. Firepie's cheese pizza is the winner for me, though all of the pizzas are great, to be honest.  The arugula and tomato salad is also fresh and delicious.  I never pick up a pizza without ordering one of these large salads, too.  And of course, Mitchell's ice cream.
author: April A.

description: Too expensive for the quantity and quality of pizza served. Lack of variety doesn't help either.
author: Andy R.

description:
Pizza places with too many choices are always a red flag for me. Pizza doesn't need to be fancy, and it doesn't need to be fussy (IMO). 

Enter my husband and I on an insanely busy weeknight. Who wants to cook dinner? No one. Not it!

We ordered from Fireside through Eat24, and it was as easy as could be. We tracked our order confirmation and delivery right from the app as we sat ourselves down on the couch to await pizzaaaaa. 

Two pizzas, both delicious, arrived in no time. And, even though we dorked up the delivery instructions, they insisted on throwing in a free Mitchells ice cream (um, THANK YOU) for "being late". And it was 100% our fault. What lovely people. 

Thanks!
author: Brittany B.

description:
Simple, Speedy and Savory.- A perfect pie for the on-demand pizza lover.    After living in SF for 18 years I have my pizza staples that I go to  when I come back to visit. Through some friends,  I learned of a new pizza spot called firepie.  I took an Uber all the way from downtown to try the new pie and was not disappointed.

1.  Simple-  After a busy day which didn't include lunch, I was starving by the time I got there  so I was relieved to find a very simple menu with 3 choices of pies, I choose the pepperoni.

2.  Speedy-  I had my pizza in less than  5 minutes. Need I say more.

3. Savory-  My favorite part of the firepie was the sauce. A consistent blend of spice and a good  thick texture.  The crust was fantastic. I'm a big fan of imperfection in my  crusts. The crust was a perfect balance of a crispy outer crust with a soft interior.  I may need to get a hotel closer to Firepie next time I visit the city.
author: Mike T.

description:
It seems like it was at least a year ago when I first tried Firepie after seeing a big sign on Cesar Chavez on the way home from the airport. Everything about the experience was revolutionary--the app, the speed of delivery, tracking the delivery as it made its way to my house. However at that time the product was simply not worth ordering again.

The other night I was rather late preparing dinner and my dear companion, who is from Italy, requested "pizza appetizer". So I ordered a veggie and a pepperoni. Honestly, they've turned things around. The crust was gloriously thin, crispy, and correctly burnt a little, the sauce was pleasing, the veggies cooked, the right amount of cheese. The Italian verdict: delicious!

I concur! Keep up the good work.
author: Seth G.

description:
For someone that rarely reviews, I had to post this about FirePie. I've been coming here ever since they opened, probably about 30+ times now and they have never disappointed. Great thin crust pizza, cooked in a 900 degree wood fired oven that is just delicious. 

Now the food is bloody amazing, but what really sets these guys apart, is their customer service and the satisfaction of their customers. A prime example is after getting there just after they closed, without knowing that I'm a regular, they gave me 2 free pizzas that they had set aside for the staff becuase I must have looked hungry. This is what builds customer loyalty, and these guys know how to do that. 

Do yourself a favor, stop reading this review and order the pizza. It won't disappoint!
author: Dan S.

description:
SO disappointed. Just finished our first FP pizzas after driving by for months and saying to each other we should give it a try. Tried each of the pizza offerings on the menu. Walked up and was quoted 2-3 minutes and waited over 10 minutes. Far more than the 90 seconds advertised, but that wouldn't be worth a single star deduction if the pizza was at last average. I should have went to Trader Joe's for frozen pizza and saved $8 per pie. I added pepperoni to the vegetarian increasing the personal sized to $15 (the only size sold) and literally got four small rounds of pepperoni on the entire thing. Crust was undercooked to the point of being so doughy it became unappetizing. Topped veggies were scarce and the requested arugula on the side was placed inside the box next to the pizza so by the time we got home it was somewhere between wilted and cooked. 

We love to support new restaurants (and food trucks) in the city and will always root for success. I'm hoping based on the other solid reviews that we just hit a bad day, but if I had to choose again today for something fast the Pizza Hut self serve at Target would win. 

Update. Always impressed when the management owner contacts us to try and resolve. The response always says a great deal about a business. Our money was refunded and invited to try again with a discount. We will try again in the near future and hopefully have a better experience.
author: Eric N.

description:
Pros: pizzas arrived in under 20 minutes with the correct toppings

Cons: the crust was not cooked all the way. When I think "firepie" I don't think "doughey basic pizza"

Was expecting piping hot crispy artisanal crunch based on their marketing, but received burnt inedible edges with doughey uncooked middle. $40 later and still hungry. Got fleeced. Never again!
author: Jordan Q.

description:
This is probably one of the best pizza places in San Francisco. I'm such a pizza lover, like I probably have pizza at least four times a month. 

I was at home one day and I was searching yelp looking for a pizza place that delivers. Well I stumbled across this place. To my surprise they delivered. Well I was a little on edge seeing that this is a food truck but from the pictures and the reviews my mind was quickly changed.

I ordered the vegetarian pizza personal size. It took about 45 mins to get to my house and let me tell you.. it was perfect! The mushroom and fresh baby arugula was what stole my heart. I mean it was in every piece of the pizza. The cheese was dripping off the sides as if I were in a commercial! I swear I was sitting there like..where have you been all my life. Honestly you have got to give this place a try. The personal pizza was a decent size if you plan on just you eating, I even had a couple of slices left over. 

This place definitely makes me want to leave my main pizza place for a while.
author: Monee C.

description: I regularly order from Firepie and love the pepperoni pizza! The pizzas are on the smaller side, but I think they are fairly priced. And the best is that they arrive REALLY fast (15 minutes or less normally).
author: Fabio M.

description: Quick service when I ordered through Uber Eats app! Awesome flavor...I ordered the pepperoni pizza! It was so yummy, I wish there were larger sizes/more slices available to order.
author: Robyn R.

description: Amazing vegetarian Pizza ! Perfect size for one hungry person ;) delivered within 15-20 mins of placing the order.
author: Alicia N.

description:
Our go-to pizza delivery place. It's tasty, it's fresh, it comes super quick, 
 it's the best. It's always great, a consistent 5 stars, and there's nothing to complain about ...

Until last night. Our pizza took "a long time" (longer than normal, at about 25 minutes) and was a bit cold when it arrived. We called to say it wasn't up to scratch, and then the refunded us AND offered to send out a fresh, hot pizza. And they even threw in an ice cream too. Fantastic customer service, 5 star service to go with their 5 star pizza!
author: Kevin M.

description: Such a perfect little place.  Each of the 3 pizzas are on point, all seasoned with the right amount of garlic and oregano to give them the right balance and edge.  I'm partial to the pepperoni with the salame picante but have enjoyed the 3 cheese and the veggie.  Simple menu lets you focus on the food, not the decision.  Need to order from here again.
author: Saminda W.

description: The owner reached out to me and refunded my order. Excellent customer service. I tried them again today and it was ready in 10min!
author: LoveFood W.

description: 20 stars. So impressed with pizza and delivery time. These were probably the first pizzas I've ever had delivered that still felt like they were straight out of the oven. And delivered in less than 25 minutes of ordering. Unheard of... Bravo Firepie! Well done!
author: Nicole R.

description: The absolute best pie in San Francisco as told by my friends from New York, Chicago and Boston. I love this place and my mouth is watering during work when I'm hungry.
author: Todd R.

description: Overall, this place has pretty good pizza. It's a bit pricey but it is open late and offers good food when most places are closed. Their staff is super friendly and welcoming, and their pizzas come out surprisingly fast! My favorite is the classic cheese pizza with basil.
author: Jacqui C.

description: Five stars for the customer service and food! Saw this walking in my neighborhood; fast forward a couple days later we decided to order delivery. 2 pizzas. Food came a bit cold. Decided to call them and let them know the food was cold. They immediately said they'd get us a new order and they will personally driver it themselves. The driver prior was a 3 rd party driver like caviar.. etc. They even offered us some ice cream which was super nice of them! they delivered it in 15 min and pizza was amazing! Thanks!
author: Nessa H.

description: this is our go-to place for a personal pizza! the staff are all super friendly and as advertised it only takes a few minutes!
author: Vicky L.

description: Amazing delivery. Ordered the cheese pie and pepperoni pie. I liked that the crust was tender but seemed a little uncooked (I love the super soft mochi texture of Neapolitan pizza, but this one seemed not quite right). I wouldn't order this pizza over zero zero, UPN, or pizza hacker, but when it's raining or I'm pooped out? Heck yea.
author: Jean L.

description: The owner, Rick reached out to me and sincerely apologized for our overcooked pizzas. He clearly cares about his business and I really appreciate his willingness to make things right. I can't wait to return and give Firepie another shot. Update to follow!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
The best valentines date a girl could ask for. 

The ratio of tomato sauces to the four difference cheeses couldn't get any feta. The overall brie-lliance of the crust was sublime. The gouda delivery man and the speediness of the cooking was grate...

Overall huge fan of the cheese pizza, if you couldn't tell.
author: Kate F.

description:
I've heard great things about Firepie and last night decided to finally give it a try. I ordered the veggie pizza based on photos. Well my pizza arrived not hot  and I guess they ran out of veggies? It was more like cheese pizza with two slices of onion and a small bit of  diced mushrooms and arugula. Disappointing for sure. If I hadn't been starving I would have called for hopefully a real veggie pizza. 
I might try the truck in person one time but probably not delivery.
author: lisa l.

description:
One of the best pizza  deliveries I've had and by far the best I've had so far in San Francisco. The pizza is perfectly sized for a meal for one and extremely good.

The menu is very small but it definitely feels like they've perfected every pizza. I ordered the pepperoni (a classic) and it was honestly much better than many pizzas I've had in restaurants.

I also was tempted to get the chocolate  milk and chocolate ice cream for dessert which both complemented the meal. After all of that I still felt like I had a healthy meal and didn't feel guilty (as I often do after a takeaway)! This will be my go-to delivery from now on!
author: Michael C.

description:
I love this pizza. Yes, the crust is kinda burnt, but the dough is tender inside. I find the crust  very well balanced. The sauce is yummy, lots of pepperoni, and I love the sprinkling of fresh arrugula on top. Best delivery pizza for me, after 20+ years in SF.
I ordered delivery for the first time the other night. I was happily surprised at how fast it arrived. (I live pretty close) So, here's the kicker- I paid online but indicated I'd give a cash tip. When the guy arrived, I gave him what I thought was a 15% tip. The exchange was made, he left. 4 minutes later, my doorbell rang. I was mildly freaked out, it was late, but I figured it had to be the delivery guy. Yep, there he was at my door again. I had inadvertantly given him the 15% tip plus a 20 spot. It seems the twenty and  one dollar bills are sticky. And when one isn't looking closely, remarkable simliar in appearance! He figured I didn't mean to give him a 110% tip, and was back to return the twenty dollar bill. Wow, wow wow....What super nice kind, upstanding act of true integrity. Think about it, when was the last time a stanger return cash to you, or you returned cash to a stanger? You may think it meant nothing, and it was only $20. But this is the kind of thing, I'd like to do for another. Random acts of kindness matter and can have ripple effects.
Awesome pizza, great value, fast service, and great plug for the goodness of human nature.
author: Susan O.

description:
Updated update: I have been traveling and unable to get a decent pizza order in, until this evening.
Ordered two pies, the cheese and the pepperoni, and they are both delicious. Nice char on the crust, you can taste the high heat in the cheese, crunchy/chewy crust, it hits all the highlights.
Still had to heat it up a bit in the oven though, not the restaurant's fault at all, it's just better out of the oven so I am determined to go in and get the full experience at some point, I'm sure it'll be worth it!
author: R W.

description: Really good pizza. Properly cooked and quality ingredients. As it's so good I'd like it to be a little bigger for the price. Fast delivery which you don't usually get in SF. Or anywhere!
author: Kimberly ..

description: We always walk by but today was our first time grabbing a fire pie. We got, Great service, it was Fast, and I was surprised at how delicious & flavorful it was.  We got a pepperoni pizza and a small arugula salad. It was 20$ Everyone in the house enjoyed it & it fed three of us. So yummy, I will definitely be stopping back by.
author: Chris T.

description:
Ordered two pizzas for delivery last night. The verdict: really delicious pizza with fast delivery! 

Pizza's both had a slight char to the bottom of the crust which really elevated the flavor. The tomato sauce had just the right bite to it. Would have liked perhaps a tad more cheese, but overall a really wonderful pizza. My wife and I will be ordering from here again next time we want pizza. 

This is one of the top 3 pizza spots in the city.
author: Marcus L.

description:
This was a total surprise.   It far outdid my expectations.   What I loved besides the very 3 simple options were A)great thin crust B) great sauce, but C) that it was done in 90 seconds and they were EXTREMELY FAST ,FRIENDLY and COURTEOUS!  
I will definitely order on line for 15 min delivery.   This is KILLER pizza from someone who made pies for a living for 2 years.   I have high pizza standards!
author: Scott F.

description:
I ordered the individual pepperoni pizza and a three twins ice cream via Eat24 and received only the pizza. Though the delivery was speedy I was quite annoyed that I didn't get the ice cream as it was $5 for one little cup! 

I tried contacting Eat24 will little success so I called FirePie directly and was received well. They offered to send me an extra ice cream because of the mistake. 

I'm giving then four stars because the pizza was delicious and they offered to fix their mistake. Maybe in the future I'll call to confirm they have my order right.
author: Priya D.

description: I'm not sure what is going on. There are a lot of good reviews so we ordered a pepperoni through Uber eats and it was terrible!! All burnt on the bottom, around the crust and tasted like frozen pizza. Super disappointed :/
author: Jessica B.

description:
Firepie was quick and convenient! I decided to give Firepie a try after reading their mission statement. Quality ingredients delivered FAST! 
I requested a change to my order. I received a call immediately after placing my order, and spoke with a very friendly guy. 
I got the cheese pizza with basil, and the pepperoni for my husband. 
The pizza was delivered as described, and it was delicious! I will be ordering from Firepie when I'm in the mood for pizza, and I highly recommend it!
author: Roz M.

description: Firepie is quite a tasty treat, especially moving to SF from NY! Their pizza tastes like home with a local fresh kick to it. It's such a convenient location, especially if you are biking home from work or hopping off the tech buses. I was impressed with their customer service since there was a mistake with my order (be sure to check a previously saved address when ordering through yelp). The manager helped make sure the problem was alleviated and even offered  a free dessert. Love the customer service William!
author: Wendi K.

description: Really the only option for pizza delivery in Noe Valley. I've tried them all and trust me, don't go anywhere else. Super prompt delivery and high quality product. I just wish they had a bigger menu.
author: David D.

description:
Perfect...if you are drunk, in the area, and looking for something to eat well after all the other restaurants are closed. 

The staff and service were great. The pizzas were sorely lacking. First, the pizza is very small for the price, even compared to Neapolitan pizzerias you sit down at -and this one doesn't have seating room or table service (food truck). The crust was, paradoxically, both burnt on the outside and too doughy on the inside, the vegetable toppings tasted like they came out of a can, and the sauces had off flavors.  

As a pizza connoisseur, I couldn't decide what kind of pizza it was trying to be - Californian, "Pizza Hut" style, New York, Neapolitan, etc. I wanted to like it, but I couldn't. I do support the concept of a pizza food truck. They should find a style and go after it a bit more thoroughly.
author: Abi S.

description:
Finally an AMAZING pizza establishment in the City! It's baffling how hard it was for me to find a great pizza in SF. I'm so pleased to have finally discovered FIREPIE. The pizza is always hot, consistently cooked to perfection with high quality ingredients, and delivered faster than any other pizza parlor. The staff is very friendly and the owner, Rick, is intimately involved with operations to ensure quality and service are top notch.

Highly recommend this if you want a fast high quality pizza delivered!!!
author: Steve H.

description: Tried one pepperoni and one three-cheese pie last night. My partner picked them up on the way home. Very quick purchasing process, as the pizza is done in about two minutes from the time you order at the window. We like the chewy crust and the toppings are top quality. We live four blocks from the Firepie truck on Cesar Chavez at Valencia, and the pizza was a good temperature and ready to eat after she walked home with them. I think Firepie is an excellent option when you need a quick, tasty dinner with good ingredients. Will be trying their salad next time. They also have Mitchell's and Three Twins ice cream if you really want to blow your diet. Highly recommend Firepie and I hope they are successful in their expansion to other neighborhoods.
author: Eileen B.

description: SOOOO GOOOOOD!!! One of the closest to East Coast pie I've had here in Cali. The crispy thin crust, the sauce that is so flavorful and has a nice little kick on the back end, and the fresh basil to top it off was EVERYTHING. You can certainly tell that the folx that run this place truly care about what they do. TRY IT!!! Worth it!
author: JASON D.

description: Did not like the burnt crust and bottom. Need to figure a way to cook and keep it crispy without burning the bottom and crust
author: Erika E.

description: We tried Firepie for the first time tonight. We ordered 2 pizzas for 2 people and it was plenty of food. Most importantly, it was DELICIOUS! Also, we loved that our pizzas arrived within 15 minutes of ordering. Can't beat that! Will definitely order again.  :)
author: Claire B.

description: Love Firepie! Their staff is always curteous and friendly, the pizza is delicious and most importantly comes out hot in around a minute. Definitely my go-to spot for dinner when tired after work and need good food.
author: Bianca O.

description:
We order Firepie from UberEATS on the way home from work min once a wk. Order to door ~25mins.
I go Vego, he Pepperoni & they nail it every time. I'm always hesitant to order pizza as I don't like 'naughty' food for dinner, but Firepie pizzas are different - crispy, clean & super delicious.
The crust.
Best crust. 
And the ice cream.
Stop.
author: Bel J.

description:
Great quality wood fired pizza in 90 seconds!
Order online or call and just show up at their truck. They put the pizza in when you show up, wait 90 seconds!!!.. and voila your pizzas are ready.
Only 3 but really good options to choose from. Makes life easy when you don't have 20 options to choose from. :)
The size and price are pretty reasonable too! Not too big if its just for 1 person, unlike some other places where you have to spend 20 bucks and carb load with pizza for 2 days!
Would definitely go again for that quick fix pizza! :)
author: Vikram C.

description: So good thin crust with magic texture! Fresh simple and delicious. I am a fan!
author: Mark W.

description: A friend of mine brought me here, I wasn't sure what to expect and was pleasantly surprised! The service is great and the pizza was super delicious and fast! The crust is cracker thin, which I love. I hope they expand so that delivery is an option in my neighborhood some day soon!
author: Kimberly R.

description: I'm a local so I've eaten here a few times. Overall experience has been meh until my last visit, but I'll start with the basics. IMO, the pizza is very overpriced for what you get. I can't justify spending $13-$14 on a very small street side pizza. The taste is also very average, and if anything, underwhelming. I keep returning because I was hoping the quality would get better, and because it was so conveniently located, however my last visit was awful. Ordered a pizza on site, and I was given a very burned pizza- not exaggerating here, as I've eaten pizza from here multiple times. I nicely asked the woman in the food truck if I could get a different one because this one was burned, and she essentially blamed me and told me next time I had to "specify how I wanted it cooked, because lots of people like over cooked pizza." ??? Am I supposed to say I don't want burned pizza every time I order? I can handle pizza that's a little too pricey, but terrible customer service too?
author: Emily L.

description: We were staying in the City with friends and didn't know the area well. Found Firepie on Yelp, downloaded the app, and from checkout to the doorbell ringing from the delivery guy was around 20 min!!! I was SHOCKED at how fast it was. I was thinking that I wasn't going to be eating for at least an hour. The wood fired pizza was delicious, the prices were decent, and the service and delivery TOP NOTCH. The app was a breeze to use. Extremely impressed, nice work Firepie!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Two quality, tasty pizzas within minutes. Can't beat the convenience. 

One of mine was overdone, so they did another really quickly and perfectly. 

About as much as a sit-down personal pizza and no fuss. If you come after hours the parking lot is closed and you can pull up your car in the driveway and grab and go. It's on the westbound side of Cesar Chavez, so if you are coming from Noe Valley or Castro by car, turn on Valencia and make three quick rights to vector in. 

Wish them much luck. (And the Boylan's soda is a treat. Haven't had one since I moved from the East Coast.)
author: Michael W.

description: Up front.....I don't rate carry out pizza very high because it comes in a cardboard box and the crust never survives the steam.  Having said that, this is pretty good, very fresh ingredients, reasonably priced, thin crust and really fast delivery.  If you need a pizza delivered late at night, you won't be disappointed in the quality and speed it arrives at your door.
author: Doug B.

description: Delicious, real firewood pizza. I ordered a regular pepperoni. And it just enough for two people. Really dig the arugula on top and the service is quick and friendly!!
author: Liset O.

description:
I love Firepie for many reasons. I love the business model. I love the quality of the ingredients. I love the just enough/not too much size of the crust. I love the location (right off Cesar Chavez on your way home).  I'm all in. I would go more often if my waistline allowed for it.  It is a generous size individual pizza - if you get the delicious arugula salad with the delightful house-made vinaigrette, it is a lighter meal for 2.  If you are starving, you may actually still have trouble finishing one pizza by yourself. 

I take issue with the guy who said he felt 'ripped off' for a $15 personal pizza.  You know the price going in.  If it is too high for you, you don't value the elements and effort that contribute to that pizza. And that's fine, but then don't complain about it.  Also, the pepperoni, that is the most expensive of their pizzas, is only $13.  Their veg or 3 cheese are $12 and $11 respectively. 

DO it. Try it. Support this business (this is not a paid ad! really!)
author: Michele B.

description:
After my initial review, the owner got a hold of me and graciously offered to try again on their dime. I'm happy to say the new order was as good as the first few I had, so it seems the pizza in my original review was an outlier. 

So I'm updating my review to 5 stars since the owner went above and beyond in fixing the problem, and delivering me some truly great pizza!
author: Andre S.

description: Great pizza, delivered super fast. Just what I've been waiting for!
author: Adrian A.

description: Generous size and speedy delivery.  Excellent customer service.
author: molly m.

description: Definitely not the best fire cooked pizza I've tasted. I ordered the three cheese, tres formaggio. It got the job done. The free three twins vanilla ice cream mini cup was a really nice sweet treat at the end. :)
author: Shruti D.

description: Just had delivery from Firepie and it was great! Quick turnaround, delicious pizza, just the right size for me. Even the delivery guy was super nice! I am truly confused by the one star reviews here. Yes, $20 (including delivery and tip) is a bit high for what is essentially a single serve pizza, but if you are just focused on price, stick to Domino's.
author: Nick R.

description:
Yummy crunchy crispy crust, zesty ingredients, cheesy delights. Perfectly baked mouthfuls.

If you order online from the Eat24 app, don't heed the time estimate - just go straight to the pickup window on the sidewalk. You can park temporarily in the mini lot while you pickup the deliciousness. And don't forget to check in to score your free ice cream!
author: Cilla T.

description:
Just had visited your location. Read the letter before I ate. Good touch
Cons:
15 dollar personal pizza. 
Felt kind of ripped off. 
Lacked substance, wasn't much cheese or pepperoni. 
Ate a lot of crust.
Tough, it hurt my teeth for an hour after. 

Pros:
Presentation was beautiful
Fresh ingredients
Lightning fast output. 
Right amount of marinara
author: Geezy L.

description: This was our first time trying Firepie, and it did not disappoint. We ordered 2 10" pizza pies, Three-Cheese and Pepperoni. Both were equally satisfying and delicious. We loved the fresh herbs as garnish (Basil, and arugula)! From the time we stepped up to order to receiving the pizzas was less than 3 minutes!! We also used the yelp check in to receive a Three Twins Ice cream (Chocolate or vanilla) yummy! We will definitely be coming back!
author: Wendy H.

description: Can't go wrong with some Firepie pizza! Ready in 90 secs! Hot and fresh! I love the quality of the pizza - fresh ingredients does it for me. The individual pizzas are a great portion for any pizza lover! This place is my favorite for a late night Pizza craving after some drinks. The waters and drinks can be pricey but the overall product is great. Come give it a try!
author: J M.

description:
Saw this place driving by and stopped in for our first order tonight. Very quick service. Both the woman that took my order (1 Pepperoni, 1 Three Cheese), were friendly and smiling. The pizzas were out in less than 3 minutes and they even made sure to offer peppers, and Parmesan. As advised, remember to hold the box level to avoid your toppings from sliding.  
Pizza was outstanding. Much better than similar concept strip plaza places, and the customer Service was top notch. 
My only complaint is we live too far to expect delivery to South City. 

3rd option is the veggie pizza, which we'll be sure to try next time. 
Thanks for a great experience, we'll be back and tell our friends.
author: J H.

description: The pizza was delicious, it arrived quickly and warm, and when we called Firepie regarding our order, the woman we spoke to was extraordinary.  It was such a happy experience.  Thank you!
author: Michele M.

description: I enjoyed these pizzas and they were delivered _fast_, which was awesome.  One of them was a little black on the bottom, giving it a bitter taste, and plus the blackened material isn't good for you.  Maybe the chefs can keep an eye out for that in future?  But I'd still order from here again, for sure.
author: A. Z.

description: It's super fast. And it tastes pretty good. The pizzas are not a typical Large but not personal either. For two people you need a salad. I'd like to see more toppings options or at least more veg.
author: Will D.

description:
Man, I remember, in high school, if I turned in a paper 90 seconds after it was assigned I'd get CHEWED OUT and get that thing thrown back in my face! After all, 90 seconds is barely enough time to write "PIZZA TAKES LONGER THAN NINEDY SECONDS DUDE."

So when they called my number 90 seconds after I ordered, I was incredulous. I was ready to impersonate Mr. Ripp and rebuke them for not applying enough critical thinking to my dinner.

But no, no, I'm a man of restraint. I held my tongue, and instead applied it to the product. YOWZA! Probably the best I've had since I left my hometown in New Jersey. Let's break it down:

Sauce is LIT. Bold and tangy.

Crust is thin where it's the cheese and sauce's job to entertain, but firm and subtly sweet when you need someone to listen. Oh, and the pizza as a whole is PERFECTLY MIL-SPEC circular. This was the first pizza I could set my watch to.

Cheese is... good. Stretchy and freckled.

Overall a worthy, if not dangerous deal for 13 dollars and 90 seconds. Convenient and delicious. Well done Rick.
author: Ying C.

description: My favorite pizza delivery! Fast, friendly service. Fresh ingredients, perfect crust, non greasy! Yum!
author: Vicki L.

description: Tried their pepperoni pizza last night.  It was superior.  Crispy crust slightly burnt on the edges with a puréed tomato sauce, light covering of cheese, arugula.   Easily the best pizza I've had in ages.  Wholesome, fresh, delicious to the last bite.
author: Catherine A.

description: I tried them once on a recommendation of a friend; I even tipped in advance because of their 15 minute delivery promise.  I won't use them again.  It took 45 minutes for them to arrive, the driver was loaded with at least 4 other orders, and the food was mediocre in my opinion.  I got a brief "sorry" from the driver as she handed me my food and tore off.
author: Jason M.

description: Firepie is our new go to pizza for delivery. The three cheese pizza is always delicious, the crust is cooked to crispy perfection, the arugula salad comes with a lovely dressing, and the delivery is always very speedy as promised. Getting a little Three Twins ice cream when we order two pizzas is a great touch as well :)
author: Kendall O.

description: OUTSTANDING pizza. This stuff is crazy good. The sauce is delicious and the crust is just right. Not sure which is better...The piping hot pizza the night of, or the cold pizza from the refrigerator for breakfast the morning after. Actually they are both so good that one could never choose. Love the simple menu...My brain is already fried from decision paralysis and having to make choices all day long. When you need hot, delicious food, look no further. No tough choices to make here. Just ten menu items and all are amazingly yummy. Pick one and you're on your way.
author: Joni W.

description: Ordered from Firepie a few times and have been very happy.  The pizza is consistently cooked properly and delicious.  They are also fast fast fast.  I live about a block away, and if I order via the app, and walk out the door they are always boxing up my pizza as I walk up.  Some of the best pizza I've had in SF.   A+ guys!
author: Nick G.

description: I'll say this: definitely a "good pizza." Not the best, but pretty darn good. What is special about this place is if you're starving and there's nothing in the house and you NEED pizza, Firepie has your back. The delivery is fast AND you can track it for when your hands are quivering. If your vision goes blurry there's text updates. Nice work FirePie!
author: Matt N.

description:
Decent pizza - better than a food court or greasy no-name pizza joint. Unfortunately, the delivery experience is underwhelming. I paid $37 after tax, tip and the delivery charge for two 10" pizzas, a veggie and a salami. Easy, right? A bit on the expensive side, but it was after 10, so the value proposition was still good enough to justify the premium. They send you a link to a browser app that lets you track the delivery driver for whatever third party startup they use for delivery reminiscent of a ride-sharing app - cool. Arrived under 30 minutes. Great. Then the driver comes up to my door and says, "Here's your pizza" and hands me a single, 10", personal pizza.

Now I feel like a schmuck. The value proposition has deflated - I just paid $37 for a 10" pizza. The driver calls up the restaurant to sort it out, promising to get me my pizza no matter what. Great. I get another notification on my phone for an order... Ok, looks like they're trying to make it right. However, I never get a tracking notification this time. Wait an hour and a half until midnight - when they close I believe - and never get my salami pizza. No phone call, no refund notification in my email, no pizza, nothing. Zero percent effort at customer service. The only customer service I got was from the driver​, who works for a different company, and that was a lie.

I have a one-strike policy for this sort of nonsense. If they had made good, I probably would never order delivery from them again, but I might stop by the truck if I'm in the neighborhood some time. The way things stand, having been stiffed an entire, already overpriced, pizza, I have to put them on my blacklist. It's too bad, because very few places in the city deliver or even serve that late. If you're​ up late and near the truck, I'd say hit them up. Otherwise, take a pass.

Update 05/20/17:

I got a message from the dispatcher mere minutes after posting this review. Apparently he had thought they sent back my missing pizza plus a couple of comped ice creams. So I don't know if there was miscommunication or the driver snagged my food, or what. They also comped me this order back, which is great. The dispatcher also wants to comp my next meal, which is a great gesture. I probably won't take them up on it, not because the food isn't good, but just because I'd like to move on.

I upgraded my rating from one star to two and they're off my personal blacklist, at least for food trucks if not for delivery. The service they use is ChowNow. I have to say I definitely have a preference for Eat24 after this. I probably won't order from anyone served by ChowNow in the future; I don't have experience with Caviar yet.

Here's the thing about delivery, for me anyway: I'm a home chef and I've worked in the restaurant industry. I cook a lot. So I don't order delivery casually; when I order delivery it's because I don't have food in the house and it's too late to want to go to a sit-down restaurant or get takeout, not to mention most of those places are closed. We also don't live somewhere particularly dense where you can just walk down the street to the late night taco place set up in the front of a closed tacqueria to serve the bar crowd.

So if the order gets messed up, I go to bed hungry. Got to get it right.
author: Steve S.

description:
Firepie is fast (90 seconds), it's a food truck so you have to walk over but can order on Yelp. 

The owner tries to accommodate vegetarian needs and is friendly. 

They include a newsletter in the bag and lots of toppings.

You can get an ice cream when you check in on Yelp so do it!

The salad is fantastic and the three cheese pizza is good. Salad is best in my opinion. 

Quick fast food.
author: Chhaya N.

description: I don't know what all this hype is about. All these five star reviews? I am too a pizza lover, but this pizza place is nothing special. Regular tasting pizza, OK crust, OK toppings, OK service. I came here once and don't think I'll make any effort to come back here again.  There are much better pizza places in SF with much tastier pizza. Please people, stop being sheep and stop copying each other opinions!
author: Ken L.

description:
Amazing pizza and even better customer service!

I ordered a pepperoni and made a special request for fresh basil via the Yelp app. 12 minutes later I picked up my order and walked at to Dovre Club to watch the rest of the Giants-Cubs game (elimination game). 

After my friends and I were a slice deep in received a call from a team member of Firepie - who let me know they accidentally added arugula instead of basil. 

I said we're fine it's an honest mistake but the team member insisted they give us the correct order and wanted to know if they could deliver it. 

I agreed and 10 minutes later we had a pepperoni and basil pizza delivered to Dovre Club. 

This was above and beyond customer service and I'm so thankful the team at Firepie care so much about their customers.  THANK YOU!
author: Jacob E.

description:
The hubby and I had some late night cravings and this is the first place we thought of... Awesome concept, we got our pizza via Uber in 15 mins and it was piping hot. Nice smoky crust and delicious toppings. However the center of the pizza was a bit floppy and soggy feeling. I have a feeling that happened in transit in the cardboard box. 

Great customer service and would definitely have again in the future.
author: Divya P.

description:
Hands down the best pizza from a mobile location. And it's literally a block away from me.

- Crunchy crust
- Great Flavor
- Fresh ingredients

Plus the people at the counter and who deliver it are awesome. I will definitely continue to order pizza here for the foreseeable future.

TRY THIS PLACE!
author: Enrique R.

description:
This is the pizza I've always been looking for! Excellent quality, really good flavor, made really well, great price, perfect size. 

Not all bougie like most places these days. 

I am so happy to have this place around. It is a great direction for pizza. Love it.
author: Miles G.

description: I love their pizza. It's an "honest" pizza, more reminiscent of what I would get in Italy. Nice folks, very fast service.
author: Tom V.

description: It's pretty good! Very fresh ingredients and the pepperoni, a classic, is well made. However they are a little bit too expensive for the size. That's why I don't give 5 stars
author: Mathieu F.

description: The best and fastest delivery you can get. Delicious, life-saving, pizza that is open + delivers late.
author: Alex M.

description:
Super speedy delivery - I pre-ordered (before they opened at 5) and my pies arrived just a few minutes after 5pm. 
Good pizza, I like the smaller size, it encouraged me to get 2 different kinds. Or maybe it just let me rationalize getting more...
author: Charlie H.

description: Absolutely the best San Francisco experience We have ever enjoyed. It's 11:54 pm on a Saturday night  and We just arrived to UCSF to visit a relative in the ICU. I searched "open now" and found a 4.5 star rating for pizza establishment. I called to order 3 personal pies. I asked if it was too late to order and  was told "We close in 5 min but will gladly fill your order". I arrived at 12:20 after driving 5 miles through some unfamiliar terrain. I pulled up to the curb and was met by an angel with two bags in hand. She proceeded to hand me 8 perfect pies with peppers, cheese and a huge smile. I reached for my wallet but she refused to take my money. She said, "I hope your night improves, this one is on us"! This random act of kindness forced tears from my eyes and to top it off the pizza was phenomenal. Thank you Firepie, We will never forget you!
author: Aaron U.

description:
Updated 05/2018
Something has happened with the quality of pizzas. The last few times we ordered from Firepie the pizzas have been burnt on the edges and bottom, and there's an uneven distribution of toppings. Some slices have no cheese or other toppings! Disappointing! :(

Original
I looove firepie! The delivery is always speedy and the pizzas are delicious. We generally order 2-3 different personal pizzas and split them and the price is reasonable. We order it when friends come over and they become firepie converts. It's so easy to eat a whole firepie in one sitting, which is not a complaint!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Really fast, very tasty and friendly folks ..will definitely come again!!

Simple menu and decent prices.  We had the pepperoni and it was delicious.
author: Susan W.

description:
I've been waiting for this pizza ... for a long time. Firepie has the ingredients all right--the crust is perfectly crunchy and soft at the same time (and there's not too much of it), the dough is soft and tasty, the sauce is notably good. And what's even better - it's about $10-$12 a pie. It always pains me to go to other places that charge $20-$25 for a small pie that's not even that good (I've been to Naples, I know what good is). 

The people who own the place are so nice and friendly! The best part: I live right down the street, and a simple walk to Firepie and I'm satisfied in-a-pizza-way. Now that's serious satisfaction. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: Annie G.

description: Tonight was my first time at your place. The pizza was awesome not greasy just enough to share with a salad and drinks. The place is adorable.  You actually came out of your office to check on your staff. Cars were pulling up and people were walking up to order food.  I look forward to my next visit. Thank you for having a nice place in a good location. If you set chairs outside during the summer months that would be great as well.  Wishing you, your family, and staff the very best. Enjoy. Hugs and smiles
author: Ms Lux G.

description:
Here's the deal - you're busy on a weeknight. After drinks with friends, you invite them over to your place to watch the Olympics and you don't have anything to eat at home. Wood-fired pizza - fast and really, really good. Tasty, classic pizza, with choices, but nothing super exotic. A simple menu with some choices, but SIMPLE and tasty and easy to pick-up in a central location in the Mission. People - this is my go-to pizza place now.

Get on the Firepie bandwagon, ok?
author: maureen f.

description:
Hi Team FirePie! Very quick delivery, great crust and the price is right! We just got back from Mexico and needed pizza. They actually had really good pizza in Mexico :) We just wanted more from home thus we tried yall. We were/are very happy. Only things we could suggest are:  

-A pesto sauce pizza would be great.
-Less cheese. Let the other flavors shine through. 
-A bit more arugula in the salad. 
-Overall, 5 STARS. xoxox! 

Molto bene! We will be ordering again. Thank you very much. -Reese & Yvannia
author: Yvannia P.

description: When they say 90 seconds they mean it. Fresh ingredients, good crust, one very happy customer.
author: Caitlin O.

description:
Oh damn! Where did this little bad-ass food truck come from! I wanted some quality pizza delivery and options are limited after 10PM. Was considering order Delfina via Caviar, but that would have taken an hour and the surcharge prices on Caviar are steep (plus by the time it gets here its soggy and cold, not worth the cost).

Ordered FirePie at 10:20 (they close at 10:30), got my pizza delivered at 10:36. Pizza was hot  and delicious. Sauce, dough and the rest of the ingredients are on par with any other high-end pizza places I have tried in the Mission, Noe Valley, Castro, etc. This is my new favorite go-to spot. Especially since Twin Peaks went downhill when they switched ownership (not that they could compare to wood fired pizza).
author: Mike R.

description:
Ok pizza. Some bites were delicious, but others were completely missing cheese or any flavor. I had multiple bites that weren't that great. 

However when cheese and pepperoni were on the parts of the pizza I ate it was good. 

For $25 (including tip) and the very small size of the pizza I wouldn't recommend. 

Maybe I should've ordered extra ingredients? But how much would that have actually cost?!?!

My fav pizza place is down the street (I'm a HUGE pizza fan) and by only walking a block I would've saved $7 plus had an AMAZING pizza. 

I was trying to come out of my comfort zone and try something new. Was hoping this would be the spot.
author: Rachel G.

description: Completely totally amazing pizza.  Great ingredients, crust, execution and overall experience.  Friendly staff, tasty arugula salad with a perfect lemon-y dressing.  Among the best pizzas I have had in SF or anyplace else - without any of the hassle.  Well done!!
author: Tani W.

description:
Pretty solid pizza. Good service. Good sauce. Good price. Made quick right after order. Solid amount of food, always eat a whole one. 
I think the crust needs some work... don't get me wrong it's good, but not the best. Pizza could use a more liberal amount of toppings.
author: .Strapped ..

description: Thumbs up to FirePie Pizza. Good pizza, prompt delivery, easy to use. Have ordered twice from them in the past week and quite pleased. Getting good pizza delivered (or good pizza period) has always been an ordeal in SF, but FirePie has just become my go-to place. They have a smart system: limited options but quality taste and they set expectations all along the way with email and texts on delivery status. Recommend!
author: Fred C.

description:
Good pizza 
And fast
Flavorful
You can taste the quality
Fast convenient i like it

I am not sure how it rates overall with the best of the best so I'm keeping it at 4 stars but 4 1/2 may be more appropriate
author: Anthony C.

description: Cute concept, fast, but not what I was looking for in terms of taste. Salad was not worth it.
author: Jenny P.

description: Stumbled across Firepie the other night. Got the pepperoni pizza - BEST PIZZA OF MY LIFE! I'm in my early 30s so I've had lots of pizza (in Chicago, NYC, Italy, the East Bay). Hands down the BEST!!!!!!!  I AM NOT JOKING - THIS WAS SO GOOD I WOULD REQUEST IT AS MY LAST MEAL IF I WERE ON MY WAY TO THE ELECTRIC CHAIR.  Their shop is a walk-up/pick-up trailer with a few picnic tables set up. If you eat there you'll be sitting outside in a covered space.
author: Heather J.

description: Tried it for the first time, the pizza was so fresh and soft!! Mmh! Will for sure be back!
author: Jacob L.

description: My first visit to Firepie didnt go so well, and i wrote a previous review, and i was contacted my the owner almost immediately to help straighten everything out and come back and give a second chance, and im glad i did. Wow is all i can really say. The owner Rick, is a very down to earth guy. It means alot that he went out of his way to take care of this experience. And this time i got the pizza the way i wanted it and it was outstanding! If I can give him and his staff 10 stars, I would. Thank you guys so much for taking care of me, it really shows that you guys put the customer first. I will definitely be back again, and again, and again, etc. etc. etc.!!!!!!
author: Michael S.
