description: Ordered via Eat24; delivered in less than 30 minutes. Excellent wood fired pie. Thin crust is perfectly crispy and chewy in all the right places. The smokiness of the oven blends nicely with the fresh ingredients.
author: Jon L.

description: Need pizza fast n on the go, in a rush. They don't make it till you order it. Done in less than 3 mins. Eat it while it's fresh. It's real fire where they cook it. All hands on deck. Might be slightly burned on the crust part but still good.
author: Dez D.

description: Without a doubt, best pizza I've had in San Francisco. Excellent atmosphere too. Awesome
author: Ralph M.

description: Great pizza.  Was really bored with the normal pizza around my house within delivery distance.  How fast it got delivered to the house was unreal.
author: Danny H.

description:
We took the veggie pizza - La Vedura. 
It was an ordinary wood-fried ith fresh asparagus, mushrooms, and red onions on Italian whole milk mozzarella, fresh mozzarella, and aged Parmesan, ripe crushed tomatoes, Sicilian oregano & fresh garlic on Firepie's handmade Italian 00 thin crust. 
It was as expected. Decent pizza nothing fantastic. 
I ordered through yelp and they delivered at my door in 30-45 mins via uberEats. (i don't understand how)
author: Prashanth V.

description: First time here and the pie was very good. The service was friendly and the poe was ready quickly. I got the pepperoni and the cheese. My son complained that it was spicy (he is very sensitive that way) but I found the sauce to ne very good. I'll be back.
author: Jan N.

description: My boo thing was craving some pizza, so we stopped here at fire pie pizza. At first I wasn't too convinced, One look at the menu and there is no chicken! The man ordered the pepperoni. Jen made the pizza and her wood burning oven. Oakwood to be exact. You can look through the window and see the fire burning right there right in front of your face. The pizza didn't take long at all. Jen really nice of her to offer us a cookie on the house as she put it. "Let me know what you think of this, I made it and I'm thinking of selling them." Well let me tell you Miss Jen sell them!!! I'm definitely coming back if I ever want some pizza and I'm around the hood. This beats the pizza shop on 24th and Folsom!  Did I mention the garlic !!!!
author: Chenea P.

description:
The good:  FAST.  Pizza delivered in about 15-20 minutes, reasonably hot.

The not-so-good:  The pizza was more than a little burned on the bottom of the crust.  And even if it hadn't been, it was nothing special.  Not bad, but not particularly flavorful or interesting.  Also, only three types of pizza available, and 10" only, though I guess this is part of how they do it so quickly.  Pizza from Escape from New York or Zante's is way tastier and more interesting.

Advice to Fire Pie:  up your game on the quality of the pizza, and you will have something.
author: Paul M.

description: Pizza is ok nothing great or exciting. The quality of pizza is not that great either. 3 stars only because it came really quickly, otherwise would have rated worse
author: Abhishek S.

description: OMG delicious pizza! But more important, ONLY 14MIN TO DELIVER from the moment i made the order. That was incredile
author: Andrea K.

description: This is the pizza you want. They limit the menu and pay you back by getting delicious wood-fired pizza to your house in 15 minutes. Love Firepie.
author: Craig G.

description: Fantastic pizza in seemingly no time. The crust is a perfect balance between crunchy but a little bit chewy. The quality of the ingredients is evident in the flavor. Most pizza tastes like cheese and tomato, but with each of the pies I could taste the individual ingredients. I loved all the "flavors," which is unusual because I only really like pizza with pepperoni or sausage. Great pizza. You can't go wrong!
author: Liz G.

description: Great pizza with fresh ingredients, delivered in less than 15min. I've tried the Three Cheese and the Vegetarian, both were excellent.
author: Pam Z.

description:
Hey : ) 

Pepperoni Pizza $13
Arugula and Tomato Salad $5 (small)

Don't waste your money! The CRUST is the first disappointment. It's PAPER THIN! With the weight of the cheese and pepperoni; your  unable to hold the pizza without the toppings sliding off. Essentially you will end up holding the pizza like a taco. LAME! The tomato sauce is bland and flavorless.There's a hint of garlic aroma but the flavor isn't present. The cheese and pepperoni are fair. It's hard for the toppings to compliment the pizza when the crust and sauce are lacking in flavor. Lastly the pizza is top with arugula. I found it slightly odd to put cold arugula on top of pizza. It defeat the purpose of having a hot pizza. 

The Arugula and Tomato Salad is pretty great. I loved the cheese and honey vinegarette. The cherry tomatoes were nice and ripe. Every item in this dish added a pop of flavor. Where are the croutons??? I understand some restaurants don't provide croutons with gourmet salad. It should at least be an option. Without the croutons it's lacking a crunchy element. Worth the money! Get the large instead of the small. It's a $2 dollar difference. 

This is a food truck. Not a restaurant. Wait 90 seconds for a wood fired 10' inch pizza. The service is decent. Overall, I wouldn't waste my money again. 

Ordered in March 2017.

Toodles my Noodles : )
author: Audrey J.

description: The pizza is really gummy and weird! My boyfriends comment was "this has the taste and topping generosity of a $3 Celeste frozen pizza and I paid an extra $10 for it to be cooked in a wood fired oven  in 90 seconds".
author: T Y.

description:
I was kind of drawn in by the Italian wood fire displayed and the "truck" idea..kind of different.
Unfortunately the pizza didn't live up to my expectations.
Pizza dough is far from being real Italian (Il Casaro and Delfina are by far the best in the city). Ingredients seem fresh but I think the marinara sauce they use is too overpowering.
That's the only thing I was able to taste.
3 stars because I support the idea behind it but the pizza was so-so.
author: MT M.

description: That's a damn good pie. Thin crust, tasty pepperoni and an artful arrangement of arugula. Yes please. It may feel weird to order pizza from a food truck, but you won't regret it. I just finished my first pizza from here and I'm already thinking about when I can come back...
author: Alex G.

description: How can I order a pizza, and have it at my door in 15 minutes no idea, but they did it and it is awesome!!!
author: sam i.

description: Fast, delicious and well priced. Perfect for families with kids given the app convenience, super fast delivery and great flavors. This has been a hit with our family.
author: Camila R.

description: I had Firepie delivered tonight after spending a couple of hours looking into my empty fridge. So, so delicious, crazy fast and piping hot. The sachets of red peppers and parmesan were such a good touch, and I really appreciate the letter from the owner that came with my order - I have a lot of respect for your business model! I look forward to becoming a regular.
author: Em S.

description: The first time I walked by Firepie on my way home, Rick was handing out samples and introducing the concept - very nice first impression. I had dinner plans that night, but a few weeks later I found myself hungry and walking by at 12am and Firepie was still open! A cheese pizza was ready in two minutes and it hit the spot - good crust, fresh basil, and a decent price.
author: Max E.

description:
Love this place and I delighted that they now open for lunch 11:30 -2.I have an office near by and would often grab a pizza if I was working past 6 .
The pizza is delicious,hot and fresh,not heavy like some pizzas can be ,it's only 10" so is the perfect snack for me especially as the temp has dropped recently.
Best part,takes about 2 min start to finish
author: Daithi O B.

description: Very cool vibe and a nice place for a laid back dinner. The food didn't blow me away, but it's clear they make an effort to choose high quality ingredients and have a relatively unique offering with pizza.
author: Jayce O.

description: We have tried this place twice. Both times they did not have the order and cooked it while we waited. We waited 20+ min before going and picking it up, a block away, the app said ready in 15 min. It was pretty fast for them to cook, once they found the order and confirmed it. The first time the pizza was good, but the second time the crust was burned and in places not burned had chucks of charcoal in it. It was so bad that all I tasted was charcoal.
author: Naomi N.

description: Tasty pizza with a crispy crust.  Tried all of the pizzas, all are good.  Liked using Grub Hub to place the order and have it delivered.  Unlike other pizza places in which delivery can take an hour, Firepie is extremely fast with an excellent pizza. Wish the pizzas were a little larger so it could be shared, however, size impacts the speed to cook the pizza.  Fast and delicious is a nice business model that is better than big, not delicious, and slow.
author: Nancy M.

description: I was sadly let down by Firepie. We stopped by later in the evening at dusk for dinner to take home to our rental after having been on the road all day. The pizza tastes great and the wood-fired style is awesome; however, between two personal pizzas and a "large" salad (the size of a side salad composed of arugula and some Parmesan and tomato) was nothing to rave about. :( We spent around $40 for this which we realize is to be expected in the SF area cost-wise, but we expected to get a little bit more than we did for what we paid. It was a sad intro to our visit in the area. I understand the need for efficiency and simplicity so I think the simple pizza topping options are acceptable, but I would suggest that Firepie re-evaluate their salad sizing and contents (at least a variety of greens instead of solely arugula), and lower the pricing sightly, especially until Firepie strengthens its footing in the pizza industry.
author: Melanie O.

description: The pizza was made lightening fast, like less than 2 minutes. And it was so filling and delicious I wanted to cry. Maybe I was just extra hungry. In any case, 5 stars.
author: Mike G.

description:
Totally delish pizza within 90 seconds? Crazy. That's what that is. Okay. True disclosure:The person before me was 90 seconds. I had to wait 120 seconds. The guy who walked up and flashed his phone?2 seconds. 

Now if the pizza or salad was second rate then this would be a different review. But it was good. Like good crust, a little crispy a little chewy good, the sauce was good. The cheese was right on. And the basil leaves were, well they were basil leaves. 

Way better alternative to the many fairly quick over processed options. But I still shouldn't bring the kids pizza every night, right? Even if I bring the yummy arugula salad?
author: S Blair P.

description: NY style pizza cooked to thin and crispy perfection via insane conductive heat from a huge @SS oven in their little trailer. This style of cooking pizza in brick or clay ovens is the secret to awesome crust and how it was done way back in the day. Its too bad that some people are used to eating soggy domino's and don't realize what its supposed to be. Death to sponge pizza.
author: Phil L.

description: I had to abandon my pizza there because I was told it would be ready in 90 seconds guaranteed, then nearly 10 minutes later they said it would be just a few more minutes. I had called a lyft, thinking that I could trust what they said. Listen, if it's going to take 10 minutes, then fine, take 10 minutes, but don't promise 90 seconds if that's going to be unrealistic. They offered a refund as I had to run to catch my ride home. We'll see if it comes through. I also don't see how you can deliver in 15 if it takes 10 or more just to cook. That's just a regular pizza joint speed...
author: Christophe T.

description:
This is surprisingly good pizza. The toppings are fresh and generous. Sized for a hungry one. 
What will blow you away is the lack of a line ("queue" in the Queen's English)  and when they say your pizza will be ready in 90 secs, they really mean 60. 
Thoroughly refreshing experience in The Mission.
author: Scott M.

description: This pizza is perfect!!! Sauce is flavorful, meat is top notch, plenty of cheese on top. This all sits on a chewy in the middle crispy at the edges crust, that had just the right amount of char. If that wasn't enough, I got my pizza in under 15 minutes. I can't wait to try their other varieties.
author: Amy K.

description: Really good pizza! Walked by when I moved into the neighborhood randomly and took home a couple pizzas. Fresh ingredients and herbs, made really quickly. Took four pizzas home in 5 minutes! I'll definitely go back !
author: Jeff M.

description: Wow so fast and so delicious! The veggie pizza rocks my world and it's actually 90 seconds to bake. It's amazing how quick it is and how friendly the people are. Everyone should go here because I want 90 second pizza always available to me!! Hope they come to my office for lunch.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Wow what a find! Simply scrumptious Pizza!
This hit the spot and then some. The owner is very congenial and knows what great Pizza is all about. 
To top things off, he accommodated me even though it was well before opening time.
Next time you get that pizza urge, check this place out!
author: Ric W.

description: I can't believe I hesitated to order this, the best pizza delivered in record time by an uber driver! I normally heat delivery pizza in a cast iron skillet to make the bottom crispy and because it's usually room temp at warmest by the time it gets to me. This pizza came already hot and crispy bottomed--so delicious! Definitely my new go-to pizza.
author: Leah R.

description: I first tried this pizza place a stones town mall cost me about 8 bucks and I was not to fond of it my thought was you get what you pay for. So I notice the truck a cross from my job and decided to try it again but notice it  cost much but the pizza on the truck actually taste better than the one in the store. So I say that to say it taste good but cost is a tad bit pricey for the size.
author: Ruthy R.

description: Great pizza, simple menu, pretty reasonable prices (for SF), and nice guys/gal running the show. Crust was perfect and crispy, I got the vegetarian pie and it was super good. It was also super fast, I ordered and the pizza was ready in like 4 minutes.
author: Matthew H.

description: Great little food truck on the corner. Super friendly and their pizzas come out quick, and I mean like 1 minute quick. Good stuff for a quick bite.
author: Tomasz W.

description: Fast, convenient and priced just right. The pizzas taste great and are made with quality ingredients. Happy to support this new small business in the neighborhood!
author: Rach D.

description: Just discovered this place last night when looking for late delivery places. Fastest and most fresh pizza delivery I've ever had! We couldn't believe it! The pizza is great-- thinner crust, fresh toppings, perfectly cooked. This is our new pizza joint.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Hot damn this place is AWESOME! It's been shockingly difficult to find good thin-crust pizza in SF, and I've finally found the perfect pie at Firepie. Their tomato sauce is tangy and flavorful, they're generous with the cheese and toppings, and their pizzas are always perfectly cooked. All this paired with lightening-fast delivery and I'm a happy camper. Do yourself a favor and order yourself some Firepie - it's truly the best pizza in town!
author: Allie B.

description: Amazing pizza and experience! This is my first time to order with Firepie. Let me just set the stage - its a dark rainy night. Crazy traffic & proper downpour. These guys got it done. apparently their Uber delivery failed. They called me several times in an incredibly timely manner to inform me of the changes and they were personally delivering it themselves. I received a delicious pizza delivered by a sweet gal.... still wearing her kitchen apron. Wow. Btw, this pizza arrived in about 20 minutes. No delay... and it is so tasty!! Highly recommended. I admire their work ethic, communication, and pizza. Thanks, Firepie!
author: Lori B.

description:
Totally unassuming little pizza truck that pumps out great thin crust crispy pizza with tasty ingredients. 

I'd walked by it a bunch of times because it looked like any other food truck, but actually had really high-quality ingredients, and definitely will make it one of my go to pizza places.
author: zack h.

description: I love the idea, the owner and crew are fantastic. But I'm bummed to say I won't be getting the pizza again. Crust is dense, sauce is unremarkable, cheese is heavy. I'm not sure what about this is "Neopolitan". One reviewer compared it to "what I would get in Italy". Keep in mind you can get awful pizza in Italy too. If PizzaHacker had been open, I would have gone there, and next time if it's a Monday and I have a pizza craving, I'll simply exercise some self control and go without. Best of luck with the business anyway!
author: Simcha K.

description: Very nice message from the owner in response to my original review. Though I haven't tried them again yet, I think it really means something when an owner takes a personal interest and reaches out to resolve an issue raised in a review.
author: Mr. B.

description:
So yum!! Love this place. And it only takes two minutes!

Small areas for improvement: A little less charring and no touching the pizza, please :)

Fantastic pizza.
author: D C.

description: Fast pizza and with awesome thin crust. Love that they deliver so quickly too! Pizza is a good value for the price and the ingredients always taste too notch
author: N T.

description: Quick, and tasty! They never skimp on the toppings and the crust is perfect. The app is simple and does not spam you or use too many notifications. Overall the perfect easy dinner that I can order from the bus and pick up when I arrive.
author: Julia S.

description: I never write reviews but I simply have to applaud Firepie, this is place is too good to be true. The pizza is fabulous! Thin crust cooked perfectly,  and It arrived piping hot about 15 minutes after I ordered it. Granted, I live in the neighborhood but that's still unbelievable! I also ordered the arugula salad and OMG, it was fresh and delicious with cherry tomatoes and shaved Parmesan cheese. The basil vinaigrette  dressing is amazing. The menu says the pizza feeds one hungry person but I'm a big eater and I wasn't able to eat the whole thing. I'm thrilled to have found an excellent pizza at a great price, and that it will be delivered so quickly is like the icing on the cake. Firepie definitely has a new loyal customer in me.
author: Lisa A.

description: First and foremost Rick, the owner, standing on the street corner pandering to any young techie in a suit to try his "pies" is invasive and sloppy. Second, hasn't anyone seen the mice running around the trailer in the defunct parking lot yet??? Come at night...they do. Third I find the fake reviews from the owners friends (that's against the rules...bummer) to be shameful and pathetic. As far as the owner contacting people who post negative reviews and giving them free stuff to come back and write a better review (that's against the rules too...bummer), don't be impressed - if he was that great he would have executed on the first try. If you can screw up something that cooks in 90 seconds...come on. Lastly a few "pies" (such ridiculous and overly contrived branding nomenclature - feels plastic and stilted) tasted heavily of beer. If alcohol were an undisclosed ingredient perhaps a few people would be upset, particularly if they were allergic or recovering alcoholics...food for thought. All in all this little idea would be cool if it didn't miss the mark so blatantly. Does make me want to build my own pizza oven in my backyard though. The oven is seriously the only draw and Rick pimps that thing like his prized stallion...because essentially all he has is that little gimmick. He's not even the only one doing it! Hahaha. So, fanboys and gals who don't know how to cook at home and spend 25-50% of their income eating out, take a closer look at this place and watch the shallow facade fall to pieces.
author: Kurisu Y.

description: This is a business I can get behind. Besides the fact that it's FAST and the food is good, from what I've seen they go above and beyond to make sure their customers are completely satisfied. On my first delivery order, an item was missing (a small salad). When I called about it, they were extremely nice and offered a few options. Ended up personally delivering the salad to my house in about 5 minutes (on a really rainy night), and even threw in some delicious Three Twins ice cream.
author: Gabby C.

description: I step off the bus on Cesar Chavez. I am on my way to a three-hour evening class, and I am hungry. Unfortunately, the bus stop has recently moved--no more walking along Valencia and picking up a pupusa or cookie on the way. But what do I see a block from the bus stop? A food truck with a real pizza oven! The perfect solution to my dilemma! I order the cheese pizza. The ice cream is tempting, too, but I restrain myself. Two minutes later, I am holding an incredible-smelling personal pie. The taste lives up to the smell. The sauce is savory, not sugary. The cheese is gooey without being greasy. The crust is slightly singed for that smoky taste. The fresh tomatoes and basil seal the deal. Perfection!
author: Ilana W.

description: Just found my new fave pizza spot! Last night I was walking home down Valencia feeling like (no joke) a pizza. Didn't feel like waiting an hour for delivery tho, or having leftovers for days for a single person. All of a sudden I caught the unmistakable delicious smell of...pizza! (At first I thought my mind was playing tricks on me!) Firepie had just what I wanted - a fresh and delicious vegetarian pizza (perfectly portioned and affordable) made quickly and still hot when I got home. Staff was also super friendly and helpful. All I can say is: pansa llena, corazon contento. Full belly, happy heart. Thanks, Firepie!
author: missy j.

description: Simple (in a good way) 10" wood-fired pizzas. Thin crispy crust, fresh ingredients, ready in about 5 minutes. Great Neapolitan pizza. I live nearby, so I ordered with their app and just walked over to pick up my pizza, can't say anything about their delivery. I'll definitely order again, if their pizzas continue to be as good as tonight's, they'll be my goto pizza place.
author: John S.

description: This place is awesome. Great pizza, great vibes. Surprisingly fast for wood fired pizza. Definitely recommend it
author: Alex C.

description: Excellent Pizza with delicious fresh ingredients. Ordered online and delivery was like clockwork!!!
author: Scott T.

description: Worth it on all levels!!! Great taste, At a lightning speed. F**k... Where have you been all my life
author: Kevin C.

description: This is quality pizza,  folks.  A great thin crust,  snappy pepperoni, and zesty sauce.  All in all,  a damn fine little pie.
author: John H.

description: pizza was ok  but when i order a coke  they give me a weird  drink called Boylan bottling  co ( cane cola )   and my invoice went up   ...  almost $4  each  drink ...   so if you are planning to stop  getting a pizza  at this place    bring your own drink  napkins   and you have to take your trash  with you  they don't even have garbage disposal  there !
author: El A.
